result.execSummary:
The defendant Jae M. Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class A felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Eligibility for Extended Supervision after 30 years (10/4/2045).
Concurrent with: with any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any AODA/counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to go on premises of taverns/bars. Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jae M. Robinson in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant Jae M. Robinson in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties received and reviewed PSI.  Atty. Covey has a couple of support letters to give to the court.  Court will take the factual corrections to the PSI first.  Page 23. Page 29. Page 37. Court reads the support letters and states Court reviewed the PSI, other letters, other transcripts of 1st degree homicide cases.  Atty. Hoffman states recv'd conduct letter from DOC that DE is disputing just now.  Parties review the conduct report on 2/5 or 2/6 which DE doesn't remember that and wasn't at Kettle Moraine, was at Dodge Co..  Royals letter DE denies writing. T.D. speaks on behalf of victim.  P.B. speaks on behalf of victim.  S.I. speaks on behalf of victim.  Atty. Hoffman plays audio of victim impact from victims children.  State to supply a copy for the file. L.R. speaks on behalf of J.R. K.R. speaks on behalf of J.R.  Atty. Hoffman makes sentencing statement/argument. Reads DE's criminal history, some text messages, gang affiliation.  Requests DE not eligible for ES and take 25% monies from prison account to pay restitution.  Atty. Covey makes sentencing statement/argument.  Requests DE be eligible for ES after 20 years.  Ct. 2 - 1 yr/1 yr.; 25% from prison wages not prison account.  Defendant makes statement. State sites 973.20(11)(c) wages and from other monies and can set a percentage.  Court makes statement takes under consideration 3 goals (acts of punishment, rehabilation and society)  and Court imposes sentence. 

Count 1: 1st Degree Intentional Homicide
WI State Prison for 1 Life w/eligibility of ES after 30 years (10/4/2045)

Defendant Jae M. Robinson in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer George Bonham appeared.  DAY 8 - 9:00 On record w/o jury. Atty. Covey makes statement.  Atty. Ryan makes statement.  Jury in 9:06.  Court instructs jury to continue deliberations.  Off record.  9:27 am on record, recess. On record 9:47. Question #6. Atty. Covey makes statement. State v. Vaness.  Atty. Hoffman makes statement. Court comments on courthouse security. On record 10:30.  Question #7.  Court provides answer. Recess.   On record 2:23 pm.  Verdict.  Jury in 2:25 pm. Court confirms Jury has reached a verdict.  Count 1 - Guilty 1st degree.  Count 2 - Guilty. Court polls jury. Atty. Covey satisfied with poll.  Atty. Hoffman satisfied w/poll.  Court instructs jury and dismisses the jury.  State motions for judgment of convictions.  Court enters judgment of conviction.  Court orders PSI.  Set sentencing out.  PSI report go be back by April 7.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jae M. Robinson in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Linda Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer George Bonham appeared.  DAY 7 - 8:59 am on the record w/o jury. Court goes over final jury instructions.  Jury in 9:08 am. Court instructs the jury.  Jury out 9:48.  On record 10:06 w/o jury.  Court instructs gallery of closings.  Atty. Covey makes statement on exhibits and closings.  Jury in 10:10 am.  Atty. Ryan gives closings. Court does sidebar with atty's.  11:12 Atty. Covey gives closings. Break 12:08.  Jury back in 12:14.  Atty. Covey continues closing.  Break 1:06. On record w/o jury 2:04 pm. Court talks about sidebar.  Atty. Covey responds on sidebar.  Jury in 2:08.  Atty. Hoffman does rebuttal.  Jury out 2:51.  Court talks to counsel on instructions for self defense. Atty. Calkins present now.  Atty. Covey responds.  Atty. Spoentgen appears now.  Court states instructions will stay as is.  Jury back in 3:16.  Court reads more instructions to jury. Clerk draws alternates. Clerk sworn in bailiff 3:27 pm. Jury deliberates. Question #1 - 4:04. On record 4:06.  Question #2 - 5:15.  On record 5:25.  Court does written answer to some. Jury given written response.  Question #3 - 5:41. Court does written answer.  Jury given written response. Question #4 - 6:48. On record 6:50. Question #5 - 7:45.  On record 7:46.  Court does written answer. 8:07 Court inquires with jury to see where they are at in deliberations. Jury in the courtroom 8:09.  Court instructs jury. Jury to come back tomorrow morning by 9:00 am. Recess 8:15.
Exhibits 239-240

Defendant Jae M. Robinson in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court officer George Bonham appeared.  DAY 6 - 9:06 am Court on the record. Court addresses exhibits. Parties requests exhibits 22-23 & 112-121 to be sealed.  Court will address later.  Atty. Covey states may have one witness.  State needs to talk to witness before jury comes in.  Jury in 9:20 am.  Court instructs jury.  Atty. Ryan calls Michael Stier, pathologist, S&T.  Recv'd exh. 236-240.  Atty. Covey objects, foundation. Court sustains.  Atty. Covey objects speculation, no foundation.  Court sustains but need to lay more foundation.  Atty. Covey objects. Sidebar.  Jury out.  Atty. Covey makes argument on defensive wounds v. offensive wounds. Atty. Ryan has no response.  Court overrules. Jury in 10:22.  Atty. Ryan continues direct. 10:27 am Atty. Covey cross exam.  State rests 10:34.  Jury out.  Court addresses jury instructions.  Court does collaquey of DE to testify or not.  DE would choose to testify.  Break. 10:58 am Atty. Covey makes statement on sidebar.  Jury in 11:04.  Atty. Covey calls Jae R., S&T.  Atty. Hoffman, hearsay lack of foundation.  Atty. Covey excited utter.  Court overruled.  Atty. Covey continues direct. Break. Jury out 12:05. On record 1:13.  Jury in 1:14.  Atty. Hoffman cross exam.  Atty. Covey objects, asked and answered.  Court sustained.  Atty. Covey redirect.  Testimony closed 2:00 pm. Court instructs jury the evidentiary portion concluded.  Court releases jury and to be back by 9:00 am tomorrow.  Court gives copy of instructions to parties and goes thru each amendments/corrections.  On record 3:40. Jury instruction conference. 100, 115, 1014, 402, remove 400, 140, 145, 103, 161 removed, 162 delete title, 172, remove 175, 152 delete title, 158, 180, remove 275, 157, 155, 148, 147, 150, 190, 195, 300, 325, 327, 200, remove 205, 160, 460, 485, 515, 525. State withdrawn exhibits 103 & 224.  Court witndraws exhibits.  Court would like a written motion to seal some exhibits.  Parties have orally stated to seal.  Recess 4:42.
Exhibit 238

Exhibits 1-233

Defendant Jae M. Robinson in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer detective Bonham appeared.  DAY 2 - 8:15 before jury in.  Court advises of overflow room. Court reviewed stipulation, approved and made minor corrections and did an order.  Atty. Covey sites the knife rights law changed in Feb. 2016, so was illegal at offense. Court will take up after viewing of scene.  Jury in 8:20.  Court instructs jury of viewing of scene.  Jury out.  On record 9:13.  View of scene was recorded.  Court reads into the record the script of the view of scene.  Atty. Hoffman motions for order no reference on "illegal" knife or knife collection.  Atty. Covey makes argument, collection is relevant and illegal is not a bad act.  Court orders - context in this instant, the fact that knife was at scene is relevant, motion from State is denied.  Collection motion granted.  Jury in 9:34.  State proceeds. Atty. Hoffman calls officer Eric Oakeson, BPD, S&T. Id'd and Recv'd exhibits 2-70. Atty. Covey cross exam witness.  Recess 10:48.  On record w/o jury 11:06.  Jury in 11:08.  Jury question on video to make full screen, Court states no but other videos would.  State calls Anthony P. (AJ), S&T.  Atty. Covey objects hearsay. Court sustains and strikes answer.  Atty. Covey objects speculation.  Court sustains. Atty. Covey moves to strike Inman's state of mind.  Court strikes. Atty Covey objects.  Court sustains. Atty. Covey cross exam.  Recess 11:56.  On record w/o jury 1:04.  Court addresses counsels of remark from Atty. Hoffman that jury had. Court clarifies for record on testimony of witness and Court is granting the whole answer.  Atty. Hoffman wants reconsider of ruling of hearsay on Nash.  908.03(3) Atty. Covey states doesn't apply and objects.  Court will allow witness to answer question on Nash "wrong guys".  Jury in 1:17.  Atty. Covey continues cross of witness. Marked exh. 232. Recv'd.  ADA Hoffman redirects.  Witness released.  Atty. Hoffman calls Mark T., S&T. Atty. Covey objects hearsay.  Court sustains and strikes.  Atty. Covey objects.  Court allows testimony for the effect.  Recv'd exh. 72. Jury out 2:05. Atty. Covey argues over DVD. Atty. Hoffman states ID of parties clothing.  Counsels discuss. Jury back 2:15. Atty. Covey objects. Attys. sidebar.  Atty. Hoffman continue direct. Atty. Covey cross exam. Atty. Hoffman redirect. Recess 2:36.  Court addresses the sidebar of exh. 72. Jury in 3:04.  Sidebar w/atty's. Atty. Ryan calls Ryan H., S&T, paramedic.  Atty. Ryan calls Dennis W., S&T, paramedic.  Atty. Covey objects.  Court sustains.  Atty. Ryan to rephrase question. Atty. Covey objects. Sidebar. Jury out. Witness leaves room.  Parties argue over hearsay and excitement/utter 908.03(2). Jury in 3:57.  Atty. Hoffman redirect of witness. Atty. Hoffman calls Christopher I., S&T. Recv'd exh. 1. Atty. Covey cross exam.  Jury excused 4:17.  Jury to be back by 9:00 am.  Parties to be back on record by 8:30.

Defendant Jae M. Robinson in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant Jae M. Robinson in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Denny Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case.  State states appearances.  State doesn't oppose most of the motion but there are minor issues that are opposed.  Atty Covey did not file a response to the motion.  Pending venue motion.  Miranda Goodchild motion by the state, DE is not contesting it, State thinks the DVDs should be put into evidence.  Atty Covey reviewed the exhibits and DE voluntary waived his miranda rights when interviewed, not contesting this part of the motion hearing.  State calls Eric VandenHeuvel - SCSD - S&T.  State offers Ex. 1 into evidence, Atty Covey does not object, court receives.  No cross-exam by Atty Covey on the Miranda Goodchild motion.  Detective David Frie - City of Baraboo Police Dept. - S&T.  State offers Exs. 3 & 4 into evidence, Atty Covey does not object, court receives.  No cross-exam by Atty Covey on the Miranda Goodchild motion.  Cory Hewitt - SCSD - S&T.  No cross-exam from Atty Covey.  Detective George Bonham - City of Baraboo Police Dept. - S&T.  States offers Exs. 8 - 11 into evidence, Atty Covey does not object, court receives.  State offers Exs. 2, 5, 6 & 7 into evidence, Atty Covey does not object, court receives. No cross-exam from Atty Covey.  Atty Covey objects to statement from DE to Baraboo PD that the DE wanted to speak to an attorney.  Court grants the State's Miranda Goodchild motion with the reservation of DE statement that he didn't want to say anything until he spoke with an attorney.  DE's Motion to exclude prior bad acts.  Paragraph 1 - no objection.  2 - State believes this may become relevant depending upon witnesses testifying.  Atty Covey does not see relevence.  Court restates state's position.  Atty Covey disputes that DE is in any affiliations.  DE's grants motion with respect to paragraph 2 as it pertains to the state's case in chief.  If state wishes to explore it they will need to satisfy the court that there is a factual basis outside of the jury.  3 - 6, State has no objection.  Court grants motions 1, 3, 4, 5 & 6.  7a - no object.  7b - court become relevant if character comes into evidence.  8a and b are the same caviat, court grants paragraph 6, 7 & 8.  9 - no objection.  Motion granted with respect to paragraph 9.  10 & 11 - no objection.  12 - Small clip may be used to refresh witnesses, statement from Amanda may be relevant.  State may anticipate her making this statement.  Atty Covey wants prison part of statement taken out.  Motion granted with respect to paragraph 10 & 11.  12 granted as it relates to statements regarding prison.  13.  States indicates statements are admissible except prison portions.  Atty Covey agrees.  Motion granted on paragraph 13 as it relates to statements regarding prison.  15 - no objection, motion granted.  14 & 16 - Same argument from state.  Atty Covey states on 14, DE made comment re: Mr. Cook, objects to that.  On 16, Atty Covey indicates DE punched Owen Eshelweck but irrelevant to this case and objects.  State makes same argument.  Provides jury the context of the night leading up to homicide and self-defense.  Atty Covey responds to self-defense claim that the knife was the victim's and was pulled first to show self-defense.  Court denies the motion on paragraphs 14 & 16.  Paragraph 17 - State indicates testimony would be relevant.  Court denies the motion with respect to paragraph 17.  18 - Court grants motion with respect to paragraph 18 in the same caviat.  19 - No objection, granted on this paragraph.  20 - No indication of an assault on J., does not intend to use but may as additional evidence.  Atty Covey objects.  Court grants paragraph 20 as to altercations that occurred prior to that night but denies with regard to altercations during the evening and early morning hours of the incident, it is denied.  Motion to change venue - State objects.  Atty Covey states reasons for the venue change.  State cites previous cases.  Atty Covey responds.  ADA Ryan makes statement of publicity.  Atty Covey responds.  Court denies the motion on the change of venue.  Dec. 22 deadline for witness lists and motions in limines.

Defendant Jae M. Robinson in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant Jae M. Robinson in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.  Attorney Covey enters a not guilty plea.  Court goes through information/charges orally.  Court also advises parties there will be a scheduling conference set out about 30 days from last argn. date of co defendant.  Defendant would likely be transported back to corrections.  OTP would be needed if defendant's appearance is required.  State notes typically defendants are not at scheduling conferences.  Court agrees.  Attorney Covey advises his client waives right to appear at scheduling conference to be set at a later date.

from Court
Cover Letter from Atty. Covey
of Prelim held on 10/14/2015, Cindy Brandt

Defendant Jae M. Robinson in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant Jae M. Robinson in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hoffman calls Det.  George Bonham - BPD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE Rotar.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Witness ID's DE Nash.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Witness ID's DE Harvey.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Covey stipulates to the ID of his client DE Robinson.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Atty Berkos does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Schulenburg does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Newton does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Covey does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  State has no questions and the witness is excused.  Defense attorney's have no witnesses at this time.  State waives argument.  Atty Berkos states argument.  Atty Schulenburg states argument.  Atty Newton states argument.  Atty Covey states argument.  Court finds as to each of the four DE's that there is probable cause to believe a felony was committed and binds them all over for trial.  Court addresses motion for bond modification filed by Atty Newton.  Atty Newton agrees to have that heard at a later date.  Atty Hoffman files a stipulation as to Nash's case and Robinson's case.  Atty Hoffman requests hearing be set in re: to the release of the victim.  Atty Berkos responds re: release of the body.  States he would like to review the autopsy report prior to making a decision.  State is aware of the objection.  Court states they will be in touch w/the State and Atty Berkos to set a hearing date/time.  Atty Covey notes that the RD on 11/3/2015 will likely not be necessary and an arraignment will be set at a later date and time.  Court says matter will remain on the calendar for now but doesn't believe all four if any of the DE's will be here for that date.

Defendant Jae M. Robinson appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State moves to amend complaint - victim should be A.P. Court so amends.  State gives history of DE and requests $250,000.00 cash.  Atty. ORourke makes argument.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $250,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/co actors C.N., M.H., or A.R. or surviving victim A.P.; Not to leave State of WI.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
